thread.title: Black Rock Mining on a high-grade graphite streak in Tanzania
thread.title_full: Black Rock Mining on a high-grade graphite streak in Tanzania | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: Black Rock Mining on a high-grade graphite streak in Tanzania
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors) Black Rock Mining 's ( ASX:BKT ) assays are starting to flow through from its Mahenge project in Tanzania and they are looking very interesting.

Over the next couple of weeks news flow will be extensive.

Latest trenching highlights from the Cascade prospect area include:

- Cascade Creek outcrop interval of 98 metres at 10.3% total graphitic carbon (TGC); with
- Best outcrop samples of 20.4% 18.7% and 17.7% TGC.

Adding depth to the potential graphite resource are the first reverse circulation drilling holes at Epanko Northeast which delivered:

- RC13: 24 metres at 9.0% TGC; RC14: 16 metres at 12.8% TGC; and RC15: 66 metres at 9.4% TGC.

Over at Epanko North broader zones were encountered such as RC17: 96 metres at 6.51% TGC.

A maiden resource from Epanko North is a key objective of the exploration program.

Mahenge has an initial Exploration Target of between 30 million and 60 million tonnes at 8% to 12% TGC and is contiguous to Kibaran Resources ’ ( ASX:KNL ) Epanko orebody.

Steven Tambanis managing director commented: 

“Exploration activities are progressing as planned at Mahenge with highly encouraging assay results from drilling areas and Cascade.

"Drilling at Epanko north should be completed by the end of August and Cascade is demonstrating potential to be a new graphite deposit.

"Other crews are exploring Kituti with the objective of defining additional drill targets.”

Epanko North 

Infill drilling is nearing completion and ten holes remain to be drilled for the program.

Mineralisation extends further west which will be drilled during August.

Epanko northeast 

The Epanko northeast lode is 600 metres to the east of and parallel to Epanko North.

The structure is narrower and higher-grade than Epanko north – trenching and outcrop sampling last year typically returned >10% TGC.

Three reverse circulation and one diamond hole were drilled during June.

Adding to the prospectivity of the area the reverse circulation holes commenced in graphite mineralisation indicating that step-out drilling should result in increased lode width.

Analysis 

The current exploration program continues to both confirm and enhance the prospectivity of Black Rock's Mahenge tenure.

The upcoming catalysts for the company include: 

- Additional trenching results.
- Additional drilling results.
- Any decisions to increase exploration programs based on results.
- Initiating exploration in new areas of the Mahenge project.

While Epanko North and Epanko northeast are expected to deliver a maiden graphite resource this year Cascade is shaping up as a potential stand-alone graphite zone.

Besides being contiguous to Kibaran’s world-class Epanko which has a JORC resource of 22.7 million tonnes at 9.8% Black Rock’s tenements are also in a similar geological setting.

Well-funded: 

Black Rock is well-funded after raising 3.5 million to fund its exploration activities and re-listing on the ASX at the end of March 2015.

Adding to the cash pot in May was an additional 5 placement.
 
Proactive Investors Australia is the market leader in producing news articles and research reports on ASX emerging companies with distribution in Australia UK North America and Hong Kong / China.
